Riccardo Piatti Net Worth: Here’s everything you need to know about the personal life, net worth, career of Italian professional Tennis coach Riccardo Piatti

Riccardo Piatti Facts

Riccardo Piatti Career

Riccardo Piatti started his coaching career in 1988, initially training notable players like Renzo Furlan (reached a career-best ranking of world No. 19), Cristiano Caratti (reached world No. 26), and Omar Camporese (reached world No. 18). He then began coaching Ivan Ljubičić in June 1997, at a time when Ljubičić held a world ranking of No. 954. This coaching partnership continued until the conclusion of Ljubičić’s professional tennis career in 2012.

From December 1, 2013, Piatti joined forces with Milos Raonic, sharing coaching duties with his former student Ivan Ljubičić. Raonic was ranked No. 11 in the ATP world rankings at the time. Under Piatti’s guidance, Raonic climbed to his career peak of No. 3 in the rankings. Piatti coached Borna Ćorić from 2017 until September 2019. Ćorić mentioned that one of the primary reasons for ending the coaching relationship was Maria Sharapova, a five-time Grand Slam champion, who also began working with Piatti in 2019. Sharapova and Piatti revealed their collaboration plans for 2020 on November 8, 2019.

Until February 2022, Riccardo Piatti coached Jannik Sinner, who claimed victory as the 2019 #NextGenATP Finals champion. Over the course of his career, Piatti has mentored numerous players who achieved top 10 rankings by the Association of Tennis Professionals (ATP), such as Novak Djokovic, Ivan Ljubičić, Richard Gasquet, Milos Raonic, and Jannik Sinner. Additionally, Piatti is actively engaged with tennis schools, club teams, and conducts summer clinics in Elba, Italy.

Riccardo Piatti Personal Life

Riccardo Piatti’s tennis journey commenced at nine years old in Cernobbio, Lombardia, Italy, at the Villa d’Este tennis club. His aspiration to become a coach arose at age 20 when he stepped in for the injured head coach at the Villa d’Este Country Club. His coaching foundation was established at the Nick Bollettieri Tennis Academy, now part of the IMG Academy, in Bradenton, Florida. Additionally, Riccardo’s sister, Carolina, is also involved in tennis as an instructor.
